abstract: Alex Pappademas Riff essay argues that Ryan Gosling defies conventional perceptions of what a movie star is in much the same way that George Clooney does; asserts that this can be seen in the movie The Ides of March, in which they both star.
snippet: He’s everywhere, playing every kind of role: political wonk, brooding loner, cocksure ladies’ man. Is that enough to make him a movie star?
lead_paragraph: He’s everywhere, playing every kind of role: political wonk, brooding loner, cocksure ladies’ man. Is that enough to make him a movie star?

headline.main: The Curious Case of Ryan Gosling
headline.seo: Riff: The Curious Case of Ryan Gosling
headline.print_headline: ‘Golden Boys With the Potential To Burn the World Down’
